Let $P$ be a point on the line
\[\begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix} + t \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\]and let $Q$ be a point on the line
\[\begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \\ 4 \end{pmatrix} + s \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix}.\]Find the shortest possible distance $PQ.$
inference:
Let $P = \begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix} + t \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 + 2t \\ -1 - 2t \\ 2 + t \end{pmatrix}$ and $Q = \begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \\ 4 \end{pmatrix} + s \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} s \\ 2s \\ 4 - s \end{pmatrix}.$
Then
\begin{align*} PQ^2 &= (3 + 2t - s)^2 + (-1 - 2t - 2s)^2 + (2 + t - (4 - s))^2 \\ &= (3 + 2t - s)^2 + (-1 - 2t - 2s)^2 + (t + s - 2)^2. \end{align*}We want to minimize $PQ^2.$
If the lines intersect, then $3 + 2t = s,$ $-1 - 2t = 2s,$ and $2 + t = 4 - s.$
From the first two equations, $3 + 2t = s$ and $-1 - 2t = 2s,$ so $3 + 2t = \frac{-1 - 2t}{2},$ which gives $6 + 4t = -1 - 2t,$ so $6t = -7$ and $t = -7/6.$ Then $s = 3 + 2t = 3 - 7/3 = 2/3.$ Also, $2 + t = 2 - 7/6 = 5/6,$ while $4 - s = 4 - 2/3 = 10/3,$ so the lines do not intersect.

We want to find $t$ and $s$ such that $PQ^2$ is minimized.
We want to find $t$ and $s$ such that $\begin{pmatrix} 3 + 2t \\ -1 - 2t \\ 2 + t \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} s \\ 2s \\ 4 - s \end{pmatrix}$ is orthogonal to $\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}$ and $\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix}.$ This is equivalent to
\begin{align*} \begin{pmatrix} 3 + 2t - s \\ -1 - 2t - 2s \\ 2 + t - 4 + s \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix} &= 0 \\ \begin{pmatrix} 3 + 2t - s \\ -1 - 2t - 2s \\ 2 + t - 4 + s \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix} &= 0 \end{align*}These equations lead to $2(3 + 2t - s) - 2(-1 - 2t - 2s) + 1(2 + t - 4 + s) = 0,$ and $1(3 + 2t - s) + 2(-1 - 2t - 2s) - 1(2 + t - 4 + s) = 0.$
Then $6 + 4t - 2s + 2 + 4t + 4s + 2 + t - 4 + s = 0,$ or $9 + 9t + 3s = 0.$
Also $3 + 2t - s - 2 - 4t - 4s - 2 - t + 4 - s = 0,$ or $-s - 2t + 3 = 0.$
$9t + 3s = -9,$ $-2t - 3s = -3.$ Then $t = 0,$ $s = 1.$

Final Answer: $\boxed{\sqrt{14}/3}$
